alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 29 at 2:20PM CST until December 29 at 10:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following county, Shelby. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 220 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bartlett, Collierville, Germantown, Cordova, T O Fuller State Park, Memphis, Lakeland, Arlington, Southeast Memphis, Midtown Memphis, Ellendale, Frayser, Downtown Memphis, Whitehaven, Southwest Memphis, White Station, Elmore Park, Raleigh, Parkway Village and Spring Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
